It’s all about maximizing the multipliers!
**Evaluating joker order**

I'm looking at how the Hanging Chad and Splash fit into my scoring strategy. Although I initially thought the order matters, I think it's okay to stick with the current setup. # Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

However, this would require immediate use, and the upcoming boss debuffs all Spade cards, which poses a risk, especially for my Scholar Ace of Spades. **Clarifying game mechanics with debuffed cards**

Our deck contains some Spades, but I can avoid playing them thanks to Splash. I’m realizing that when Spades are debuffed, their chip values and enhancements are disabled, yet they can still score? Actually, if a debuffed Ace is played, it doesn't trigger Scholar since its abilities are turned off.

But wait, Scholar triggers on played Aces when scored, so if the Ace is debuffed, does it still count? I think it might still count as a played card and could contribute to the score, even when debuffed.
**Analyzing Scholar mechanics and suit conversion**

I believe Scholar triggers based on card rank and scoring, so even if a card is debuffed, it can still be scored. However, its chip values become 0. This means while it won't add chips, it might still count for scoring purposes. I'm also thinking it’s wise to convert Spades to other suits before facing the boss. I've got $5 left, so I can buy an Arcana pack, which might include suit-changing tarots like The Sun or The Moon. That sounds like a good plan!
**Planning next actions with resources**

I’m considering rerolling the shop for $1, looking for better jokers like Blueprint or Brainstorm, but we can’t afford the more expensive ones. Selling Splash is an option to strengthen our deck, but it’s vital for synergizing with Ancient. I need to get hearts playing to score efficiently. 

I think I should buy Mercury first to level up my pair permanently and then the Arcana pack to potentially get suit-changing tarots. I'll go ahead and purchase Mercury for $3 now!
